Description:
DESCRIPTION:ASTSWMO REPRESENTS THE 50 STATE, FIVE TERRITORIAL AND THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA (STATES) PROGRAM OFFICES ENGAGED IN THE REGULATORY MANAGEMENT AND REMEDIATION OF WASTES AND HAS WORKED IN CONJUNCTION WITH EPA OUST FOR SEVERAL YEARS TO PROMOTE STATE/FEDERAL COOPERATION IN THE TANKS MANAGEMENT AREAS. STATE TANKS OFFICE STAFFS ARE THE 'CUSTOMERS' FOR ASTSWMO, AND THEREFORE, THE SCOPE OF THESE EFFORTS IS DESIGNED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THAT STATE AUDIENCE. ASTSWMO'S TANKS SUBCOMMITTEE ACTS AS A FACILITATOR FOR THESE CO-IMPLEMENTING STATE PROGRAMS BY ENABLING THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE STUDIES RELATING TO STATE-FEDERAL PLANNING FOR RELEASE PREVENTION AND COMPLIANCE OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) SYSTEMS, REMEDIATION OF UST RELEASES (COVERED UNDER ANOTHER COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH OUST), AND FACILITATING ACCESS TO STATE REGULATORY PARTNER PEERS, SUCH AS EPA OUST. THE ASSOCIATION ALSO CONDUCTS ADDITIONAL TRAINING AND INFORMATIONAL EXCHANGE ACTIVITIES THAT ALLOW ENHANCED INTERACTION AMONG STATES AND THEIR FEDERAL COLLEAGUES AND IMPROVE THE CAPACITY AND EFFICIENCY OF STATE PROGRAM OFFICES.ACTIVITIES:-	FACILITATE UNIQUE ACCESS FOR STATES TO OTHER STATE TANKS PROGRAMS AT ALL LEVELS AND FOR ALL SUBPROGRAMS, NOT OTHERWISE AVAILABLE TO STATES
-	ACT AS A FACILITATOR FOR CO-IMPLEMENTING STATE PROGRAMS BY ENABLING THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE STUDIES RELATING TO STATE-FEDERAL PLANNING FOR RELEASE PREVENTION AND COMPLIANCE OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) SYSTEMS, REMEDIATION OF UST RELEASES (COVERED UNDER ANOTHER COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH OUST), AND FACILITATING ACCESS TO STATE REGULATORY PARTNER PEERS, SUCH AS EPA OUST
-	CONDUCT ADDITIONAL TRAINING AND INFORMATIONAL EXCHANGE ACTIVITIES THAT ALLOW ENHANCED INTERACTION AMONG STATES AND THEIR FEDERAL COLLEAGUES AND IMPROVE THE CAPACITY AND EFFICIENCY OF STATE PROGRAM OFFICES
-	WORK WITH OUST TO UTILIZE INNOVATIVE COMPLIANCE APPROACHES AND PROVIDE RESOURCES TO STATE RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS TO BRING MORE TANKS INTO COMPLIANCE AND KEEP THEM IN COMPLIANCE
-	SHARE INFORMATION WITH STATES AND DEVELOP GUIDANCE MATERIALS, DATA SUMMARIES, AND INFORMATION TOOLS ASSOCIATED WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE 2015 UST FEDERAL REGULATIONS AND OTHER RELATED REGULATORY CHANGES
-	ASSIST OUST ON EPA INITIATIVES AND RESEARCH RELATED TO ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND UST FUEL COMPATIBILITY
-	ENHANCE AND PROMOTE CURRENT ASTSWMO TOOLS AND GUIDANCE ON UST CORROSION REPORTING AND PREVENTION, AND FUEL COMPATIBILITY 
-	ASSESS STATE ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES
-	PROMOTE CROSS-PROGRAM RESEARCH AND COORDINATION AMONG THE UST RELEASE PREVENTION, REMEDIATION, AND FINANCIAL ASSURANCE PROGRAMS THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF ELECTRONIC TRAINING TOOLS, TEMPLATES, AND FACT SHEETS
-	CONDUCT IN-PERSON AND ONLINE TRAININGS TO SHARE INFORMATION ON UST POLICIES AND GUIDANCE AND ASSIST STATES WITH IMPROVING RELEASE PREVENTION AND TANK MANAGEMENT PRACTICES
-	COORDINATE WITH OTHER STATE AND INDUSTRY ASSOCIATIONS, AND TECHNICAL WORKGROUPS ON UST COMPLIANCE AND RELEASE PREVENTION STRATEGIES
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:-	IMPROVED EFFECTIVENESS OF STATE AND TERRITORIAL UST PROGRAMS
-	ENHANCED STATE AND FEDERAL PARTNERSHIPS IN UST PROGRAMS
-	IMPROVED COMPLIANCE IN OWNERS AND OPERATORS OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS REGARDING LEAK PREVENTION AND LEAK DETECTION REGULATIONS
-	IMPROVED IDENTIFICATION OF NEW AND EMERGING ISSUES THAT IMPACT PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OF UST RELEASE PREVENTION 
-	INCORPORATION OF STATE PERSPECTIVES INTO NATIONAL PROGRAMS, LEADING TO IMPROVED PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS AND ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES. 
-	INCREASED PARTICIPATION OF STATE AND TERRITORIES IN STUDIES RELATING TO PLANNING FOR RELEASE PREVENTION AND COMPLIANCE OF UST SYSTEMS
-	CONDUCT TRAINING AND INFORMATIONAL EXCHANGE ACTIVITIES THAT ALLOW ENHANCED INTERACTION AMONG STATES AND THEIR FEDERAL COLLE

DESCRIPTION:THE RECIPIENT WILL PROMOTE THE ENHANCEMENT OF THE STATE/FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP IN THE REGULATION OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS AND THE CLEANUP OF LUST SITES.ACTIVITIES:-	FACILITATE UNIQUE ACCESS FOR STATES TO OTHER STATE TANKS PROGRAMS AT ALL LEVELS AND FOR ALL SUBPROGRAMS, NOT OTHERWISE AVAILABLE TO STATES
-	ACT AS A FACILITATOR FOR CO-IMPLEMENTING STATE PROGRAMS BY ENABLING THEIR PARTICIPATION IN THE STUDIES RELATING TO STATE-FEDERAL PLANNING FOR RELEASE PREVENTION AND COMPLIANCE OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) SYSTEMS, REMEDIATION OF UST RELEASES (COVERED UNDER ANOTHER COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH OUST), AND FACILITATING ACCESS TO STATE REGULATORY PARTNER PEERS, SUCH AS EPA OUST
-	CONDUCT ADDITIONAL TRAINING AND INFORMATIONAL EXCHANGE ACTIVITIES THAT ALLOW ENHANCED INTERACTION AMONG STATES AND THEIR FEDERAL COLLEAGUES AND IMPROVE THE CAPACITY AND EFFICIENCY OF STATE PROGRAM OFFICES
-	WORK WITH OUST TO UTILIZE INNOVATIVE COMPLIANCE APPROACHES AND PROVIDE RESOURCES TO STATE RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAMS TO BRING MORE TANKS INTO COMPLIANCE AND KEEP THEM IN COMPLIANCE
-	SHARE INFORMATION WITH STATES AND DEVELOP GUIDANCE MATERIALS, DATA SUMMARIES, AND INFORMATION TOOLS ASSOCIATED WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE 2015 UST FEDERAL REGULATIONS AND OTHER RELATED REGULATORY CHANGES
-	ASSIST OUST ON EPA INITIATIVES AND RESEARCH RELATED TO ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AND UST FUEL COMPATIBILITY
-	ENHANCE AND PROMOTE CURRENT ASTSWMO TOOLS AND GUIDANCE ON UST CORROSION REPORTING AND PREVENTION, AND FUEL COMPATIBILITY 
-	ASSESS STATE ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES
-	PROMOTE CROSS-PROGRAM RESEARCH AND COORDINATION AMONG THE UST RELEASE PREVENTION, REMEDIATION, AND FINANCIAL ASSURANCE PROGRAMS THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT OF ELECTRONIC TRAINING TOOLS, TEMPLATES, AND FACT SHEETS
-	CONDUCT IN-PERSON AND ONLINE TRAININGS TO SHARE INFORMATION ON UST POLICIES AND GUIDANCE AND ASSIST STATES WITH IMPROVING RELEASE PREVENTION AND TANK MANAGEMENT PRACTICES
-	COORDINATE WITH OTHER STATE AND INDUSTRY ASSOCIATIONS, AND TECHNICAL WORKGROUPS ON UST COMPLIANCE AND RELEASE PREVENTION STRATEGIES

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:-	IMPROVED EFFECTIVENESS OF STATE AND TERRITORIAL LUST PROGRAMS
-	ENHANCED STATE AND FEDERAL PARTNERSHIPS IN LUST PROGRAMS
-	INCORPORATION OF STATE PERSPECTIVES INTO NATIONAL PROGRAMS, LEADING TO IMPROVED PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS AND ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES. 
-	IMPROVED COMPLIANCE IN OWNERS AND OPERATORS OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS REGARDING LEAK PREVENTION AND LEAK DETECTION REGULATIONS
-	IMPROVED IDENTIFICATION OF NEW AND EMERGING ISSUES THAT IMPACT PROGRAM MANAGEMENT OF UST RELEASE PREVENTION 
-	INCORPORATION OF STATE PERSPECTIVES INTO NATIONAL PROGRAMS, LEADING TO IMPROVED PROGRAM EFFECTIVENESS AND ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOMES. 
-	INCREASED PARTICIPATION OF STATE AND TERRITORIES IN STUDIES RELATING TO PLANNING FOR RELEASE PREVENTION AND COMPLIANCE OF UST SYSTEMS.

THIS PROJECT WILL EXAMINE THE PARAMETERS THAT DIRECTLY CONTRIBUTE TO ACCELERATED CORROSION OF METAL PARTS AND TANK EQUIPMENT IN UST SYSTEMS THAT ARE IN ULSD FUEL SERVICE. THIS WILL HELP THE OFFICE OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS RELEASE PREVENTION DIVISION PREVENT RELEASE OF FUEL INTO UNDERGROUND WATER SUPPLIES BY FURTHER UNDERSTANDING THE RISK OF FUNCTIONAL FAILURE OF REQUIRED UST SYSTEM EQUIPMENT DUE TO CORROSION. THE FUELS INSTITUTE WILL TAKE TWO TYPES OF SAMPLES, IN ACCORDANCE WITH ASTM PROCEDURES: NOZZLE SAMPLES TO TEST FOR NON-MICROBIAL PHYSICAL AND CHEMICAL PROPERTIES AND TANK SAMPLES TO TEST FOR MICROBIAL CONTAMINATION AND WATER. SAMPLES TAKEN FROM A TANK WILL BE DRAWN IN TWO PLACES, ONE FROM THE TANK BOTTOM AND ONE FROM THE MIDDLE OF THE TANK.

THIS PROJECT AIMS TO IMPROVE THE CLEANUP AND MANAGEMENT OF RELEASES FROM LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (LUSTS) BY PROVIDING LUST PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION SUPPORT, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, COORDINATION, INFORMATION EXCHANGE MECHANISMS, AND TRAINING FOR STATES AND TRIBES.

THIS PROJECT AIMS TO IMPROVE THE COMPLIANCE AND LEAK PREVENTION OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (USTS) BY PROVIDING UST PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION SUPPORT, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, COORDINATION, INFORMATION EXCHANGE MECHANISMS, AND TRAINING FOR STATES AND TRIBES.

THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AND PROVIDE WEBINARS, CONFERENCES, MEETINGS AND OUTREACH PIECES, AND PROMOTE STATE PARTICIPATION IN AND USE OF THESE TOOLS FOR SHARING INFORMATION AMONG OFFICIALS OF VARIOUS STATE AGENCIES AND EPA TO ADDRESS THE CLEAN UP AND REDEVELOPMENT OF CONTAMINATED PROPERTIES ASSOCIATED WITH LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (LUSTS).

INITIATIE A STUDY TO IDENTIFY PARAMETERS THAT DIRECTLY CONTRIBUTE TO ACCELERATED CORROSION OF METAL PARTS AND TANK EQUIPMENT IN UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) SYSTEMS THAT ARE IN ULTRA-LOW SULFUR DIESEL SERVICE.

THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP INNOVATIVE APPROACHES TO BRING MORE UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (UST) INTO COMPLIANCE AND KEEP THEM IN COMPLIANCE BY PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOP AND WEBINARS, CONDUCTING RESEARCH, USING OUTREACH, AND WRITING ISSUE PAPERS.
THIS PROJECT AIMS TO IMPROVE THE COMPLIANCE AND LEAK PREVENTION OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (USTS) BY PROVIDING UST PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION SUPPORT,
THIS PROJECT AIMS TO IMPROVE THE CLEANUP AND MANAGEMENT OF RELEASES FROM LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (LUSTS) BY PROVIDING LUST PROGRAM IMPLEMEN

DESCRIPTION:THE OVERALL PURPOSE OF THIS RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT (RCRA) SECTION 8001 UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) CORRECTIVE ACTION GRANT IS TO PROVIDE CAPACITY FOR THE MAKAH TRIBE'S INVOLVEMENT IN ADDRESSING CONTAMINATION FROM UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (USTS) IN THE CANTONMENT AND TOP CAMP AREAS OF THE FORMER MAKAH AIR FORCE STATION. CONTAMINATION HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED ADJACENT TO AND UNDERNEATH SEVERAL OF THE BUILDINGS CURRENTLY USED BY THE MAKAH TRIBAL GOVERNMENT.ACTIVITIES:WORK UNDER THIS GRANT INCLUDES COMMUNICATION, COORDINATION, AND OUTREACH TO FACILITATE CLEANUP AND CLOSURE OF THE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) SITE; DOCUMENT REVIEW BY TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF AND CONTRACTORS; AND FIELD TASKS INCLUDING OVERSIGHT OF REMEDIAL ACTIVITIES ON THE MAKAH INDIAN RESERVATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE OUTCOME IS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE COLLECTIVE EFFORTS TO ACHIEVE SITE CLOSURE AND REMEDIATION OF PETROLEUM CONTAMINATION FROM LUSTS AT THE FORMER MAKAH AIR FORCE STATION. THE DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SEMIANNUAL REPORTS AND A FINAL PERFORMANCE REPORT. THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE THE MAKAH TRIBE AND LOCAL RESIDENTS.
